comments.commentBody: This from the same man who said that President Obama was not born in the United States.
I suspect it may have bee his friend Vlad tapping his phone.
Trump is totally unfit to be the president. He's coming unhinged and is unstable. Congress needs to act-now.

Obama had everything to lose if Trump won.

So it makes sense that Obama's Justice Department would have ordered Trump Tower tapped.
Pray tell, what would Obama lose if Trump won?
It must be very cold in Iceland

"Makes sense that" is not the same "did." Given the life insurance policy, it makes sense that my wife would have me murdered, but before making the accusation, a little evidence is needed, say, my body. Moreover, given that Obama was not going to be president on Janurary 21 regardless of the outcome of the election, the assertion "everything to lose" is over the top.

If it turns out that a warrant _was_ issued, then the FISA court believed that there was probable cause for the search. Thus, the the FBI was working under authority of law, not just of the executive branch. (Assuming, of course, that there was a wiretap and that the president's twittered assertions aren't just fantasies from the fever swamp.)
"a shocking lack of judgement"... how 2016

President Obama was not perfect, but his during his administration he avoided anything that had a hint of scandal because he knew, sadly, that since he was the first black president, that anything looking remotely suspicious or scandalous would have his opponents crying foul and launching multiple investigations. So the likelihood that Obama ordered an illegal wiretap of Trump's phones is nil.
Mr. Trump is showing his paranoia yet again. I truly think he needs a medical and a psychological evaluation, the sooner the better. Mr. Trump is only marginally capable of acting "presidential" when reading a speech from a teleprompter. Mr. Trump is an embarrassment to the nation.

As a post war baby, I've witnessed some incredible national political events, some dark and heartbreaking, others unifying and optimistic.

I've never seen anything like this.

The only "bad (or sick) guy" is the man who uttered these words. Donald Trump fills me with dread for our country (okay, the WORLD) every day. How can the GOP pretend to be okay with this man? Even to get some of their agenda across, it's going to cost them way too much in political capital to keep looking the other way in denial that he's "doing fine." Ryan, McConnell, Chaffetz--these guys are going to be rearranging the deck chairs until the ship goes down.

"Ah, but the strawberries, that's, that's where I had them, they laughed at me and made jokes, but I proved beyond the shadow of a doubt, with geometric logic, that a duplicate key to the ward room icebox did exist, and I've had produced that key if they hadn't pulled the Caine out of action. I, I know now they were only trying to protect some fellow officer." - Captain Queeg in Caine Mutiny

Queeg was relieved of duty, and so should be Trump.
Amazing that there is no end to the Trump tunnel of insecurities,  innuendo, and right out lies. I don't think this guy is able to make a statement based on fact. Who does he think we are?
Trump is becoming more desperate and pathetic each day. If he weren't so corrupt and dangerous to the country, I would be embarrassed for him.

Well, if Trump’s real intent is to “rip everything apart”, as Bannon’s clearly is, then Maureen’s argument has some weight. But I’d argue that the premise is invalid, that he has no desire to rip it all apart, that Bannon won’t achieve half of what he seeks, and that what Trump really wants is better balance in a country that threw away balance in its politics at least eight years ago. In which case Maureen’s concern about “calm Trump” is an empty one.

It’s a measure of how outré a character is required to re-impose balance in our hideously fractured and divided America that even Dubya is taken aback by Trump – who, by the way, didn’t create those fractures and divisions. But, then, Dubya never had to deal with the America that Trump confronts. Apart from the tactical needs of coming back from 9/11, Dubya needed to manage an America where people still were able to compromise, an America still safe for a southern Republican, whom when scratched really reveals a Democrat who opposes abortion. It’s a very different America today, one that has passed Dubya by and that Obama didn’t possess the skills to head off. It’s an America far more reminiscent of 1861, when brother was arrayed against brother in deeply-held opposed convictions.

I always liked Dubya, and I liked Obama. There’s not much to “like” about Trump, but that shouldn’t affect a rational person’s appreciation for the right tool for a job that must be done.

Aw, gee, Richard I didn't realize that an appreciation for James Joyce automatically marks me as a member of the dreaded elite.  How about Mark Twain?  Theodor Geisel?  Let me know when I've reached a level of cultural acceptability.  As for The Donald, what do you think he'll save us FROM?  Literacy?  Science?  Reason?  Compassion?  Empathy?  What happens to any society when it invests its trust in a "strong man"?  Has that ever worked out well?

Mr. Luettgen, Stu Freeman seems to have managed to get under your skin. You had to denigrate a great writer by demonstrating that you do belong to the elite who reads Joyce and that there are alleged 98 % who do not understand Finnegan’s Wake. Speak for yourself. Please.

When World War III and Great Depression II are finally over and we face life in a wasteland, we who survive, Richard will be writing comments about how it's still better than electing a democrat could have been and how everything is really much better now.  Because if he still can't see what Trump is and what the situation is better than he does now, nothing will cure the man, not the speech of men or of angels.

you're correct, and the irony is that the decimation of the regime in Pyongyang would remove the necessity of maintaining an American military presence in the South.  China wouldn't need to concern itself with having a buffer between their territory and U.S. troops if there are no U.S. troops (and, in any case, Beijing already does a great deal of business with Seoul).

Funny thing is Trump has said for months that he would like looser libel laws so he can go after his detractors and accusers. Someone one with a cooler head advised against such an idea on the grounds that more likely that, it would be easier for others to sue Trump himself.

i doubt if any of this is true...but the nsa might be taping conversations of the russian ambassador or other russians as a matter of course.  Depending on how many conversations took place between trump officials and the russians, the trump folks might think they were the target...

Trump is sinking so low that it is time to get rid of him as quickly as possible. Not only is this accusation against President Obama incredible and ridiculous it proves how willing Trump is to create fake news because he knows his idiotic base will believe him.  It's tempting to ignore this as silly nonsense but for the love of our country we must understand how dangerous Trump is and act accordingly.
Let's keep up the pressure!
Funniest phrase yet today... "the very sacred election process"

Another ridiculous diversion, to keep the media busy a couple of days or more, and make sure that Americans do not look into what really matters, his plan to squeeze America so he and his friends can become richer and richer and richer.
100% agree, plus shift focus away from Russia web.
Trump seems increasingly unstable... he doesn't sound like he's mentally sound. He's sinking the federal government to new lows.
Clearly an act that makes Trump uncomfortable.
I see there is a faction of the electorate that is willing to believe- how did some comedian put it?- the 5:00 am bowl movement tweet.
TOTUS (T for toddler) in chief was again left alone with his phone in the early morning hours, and this is what we wake up to. We need a new nanny, but a real effective one!
Maybe Melanie should live with him!
For the good of the nation, Melania needs to move to the White House and calm this man down.

That Trump tweeted at 6.35 in the morning and that he vented his anger on his staff are indications that he is frustrated. There is more stress to come - investigations into his ties to Russia, the chaos in the White House and the incompetence of his staff - can he handle the pressure?
I doubt deeply Trump's accusation. He needs to present evidence. It's more likely that he picked a conspiracy theory from Steve Bannon and used it as a smokescreen to obscure Sessions' lie during his confirmation hearing.
If Trump can't prove his claim, I hope that Obama has a legal case against him. Trump needs to get real - the accusation constitutes defamation.
Kate: you forget that for the first several years into Obama's Presidency, it was always George Bush's fault.
